result.execSummary:
The defendant Devin L Bowers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

for DNA Sample

Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
by Ashley Tipler
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.
converted to cash bond.

Defendant Devin L Bowers in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Court questions counsel on missed court appearance by defendant. Defendant indicates she completely forgot about the court date. Atty Gerbers would like to talk to ADA Korb to see if the offer is still on the table before proceeding. State makes statement, requests cash bond. Atty Gerbers gives bond argument. Court amends signature bond to a $100 cash bond. Same conditions apply.
Defendant appears on her own with Atty Gerbers.  Status conference scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Peter Heyne in court for Atty Greg Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Heyne unsure of why defendant is not present in court. State requests bench warrant. Atty Heyne asks court to stay signing of warrant to allow him time to contact defendant and make other arrangments for her to appear. Court orders bench warrant but stays signing of the warrant until 4:00 pm today.

Defendant Devin L Bowers in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers asks court to set a plea/sentencing date. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Devin L Bowers in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers requests another status the end of September to allow defendant time to take advantage of the State's offer. State has no objection to adjournment. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Devin L Bowers in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 11:45 am.
